item.title: Youth Athletes
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: Youth athletes have special needs in their training and rehabilitation of injuries. Regardless of their fitness and skill level, they cannot be conditioned or trained like an adult or a professional athlete. They have growth plates, bone-tendon and muscle structures, and stamina differences that, if not protected, will relate to injury. Sometimes these injuries can […]
item.content:encoded:
Youth athletes have special needs in their training and rehabilitation of injuries.

Regardless of their fitness and skill level, they cannot be conditioned or trained like an adult or a professional athlete. They have growth plates, bone-tendon and muscle structures, and stamina differences that, if not protected, will relate to injury. Sometimes these injuries can have lifetime consequences.

At MOTI we always approach the youth athlete with the same individualized treatment that we apply to all of our athletes, and with the utmost consideration for the youth’s unique physical development. Our Physical Therapists are trained in the care of the musculoskeletal, nervous and balance systems of the developing body. We work with the youth athlete to rehabilitate injuries and return to sport even stronger than before. And we work to educate the youth athlete, helping them to develop healthy habits for a sustainable lifetime of athletic endeavor and success.

item.title: Workers Compensation Injuries
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: At MOTI, the injured worker is similar to the injured athlete; only the playing field is different. Our dedicated therapists work with all involved parties to ensure appropriate case management, cost containment and successful return to work. MOTI Physiotherapy provides testing results that are trustworthy. We are an independently owned and operated company with the goal […]
item.content:encoded:
At MOTI, the injured worker is similar to the injured athlete; only the playing field is different.

Our dedicated therapists work with all involved parties to ensure appropriate case management, cost containment and successful return to work.

MOTI Physiotherapy provides testing results that are trustworthy. We are an independently owned and operated company with the goal to provide fair, accurate, concise, objective data and information in each specific Workers’ Compensation case.

item.title: Tennis Players
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: Recreational and professional tennis players spend a lot of time on the court, leading to many common over-use injuries. The repetitive arm motions required to serve and hit the ball can lead to rotator cuff tendinitis, shoulder impingement, and tennis elbow. It’s also common for tennis athletes to experience low back pain due to the […]
item.content:encoded:
Recreational and professional tennis players spend a lot of time on the court, leading to many common over-use injuries.

The repetitive arm motions required to serve and hit the ball can lead to rotator cuff tendinitis, shoulder impingement, and tennis elbow. It’s also common for tennis athletes to experience low back pain due to the fast weight transfers, jumping, and twisting that happen on the court.

Your MOTI Physical Therapist will work with you to relieve the painful symptoms of your tennis injury and to restore function so that you return to sport without pain and with a better understanding of how to maintain optimum performance. Your Therapist will identify the movement patterns that led to your tennis injury and help you to retrain your body’s mechanics in order to correct those movement faults. Tennis, like all sports, requires a healthy amount of cross-training off the court in order to develop the strength, mobility, and balance to keep you fully functional in the game. As part of your treatment plan, your Therapist will educate you in how to maintain these cross-training practices for your game.

item.title: Soccer Players
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: Arguably one of the most demanding sports there is, soccer requires astounding amounts of stamina, agility, and balance. Injuries to the lower extremities are the most common in soccer. These injuries may be traumatic, such as a kick to the leg or a twist to the knee, or result from overuse of a muscle, tendon, […]
item.content:encoded:
Arguably one of the most demanding sports there is, soccer requires astounding amounts of stamina, agility, and balance.

Injuries to the lower extremities are the most common in soccer.

These injuries may be traumatic, such as a kick to the leg or a twist to the knee, or result from overuse of a muscle, tendon, or bone. Sprains and strains are the most common lower extremity injuries, and the severity of these injuries can vary quite a bit. Cartilage tears and ACL sprains in the knee are some of the more common injuries that may require surgery.
Shin splints, patellar tendinitis, and Achilles tendinitis (pain in the back of the ankle) are some of the more common soccer overuse conditions. Soccer players are also prone to groin pulls and thigh and calf muscle strains.
MOTI Physical Therapists have helped may soccer players rehab injuries and return to sport stronger and faster than before. Your clinician will not only help you recover from your injury…they will work to identify the movement patterns that may have led to the damaged tissues in the first place. MOTI Physical Therapists have developed advanced, sport-specific therapeutic exercises to help soccer players increase speed and power on the field, and (most importantly) to help prevent future injuries.

If you are a soccer player, and you are experiencing pain or a physical problem that is affecting your game, come in and work with a MOTI Physical Therapist.

item.title: Skateboarders
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: In order to perform at their best, skateboarders require great amounts of stamina and power; and because they endure an enormous amount of impact on their joints, they require great strength for shock absorption and controlled landing. We have worked with many skateboarders to rehabilitate the injury and to train for optimum performance. Through functional […]
item.content:encoded:
In order to perform at their best, skateboarders require great amounts of stamina and power; and because they endure an enormous amount of impact on their joints, they require great strength for shock absorption and controlled landing.

We have worked with many skateboarders to rehabilitate the injury and to train for optimum performance.

Through functional movement assessment of the skater, we are able to identify ways to improve movement patterns and better prepare the joints for the impact of skating. MOTI founder and director Dr. Nick Cutri has led injury rehabilitation for many pro skateboarders and has worked at events for Dew Tour, X Games, and Street League of Skateboarding.

item.title: Seniors
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: Many older adults are faced with age-related problems such as loss of balance, declining muscular strength, osteoporosis, arthritis and decreased mobility. ut these same individuals still want to live a full life. Any of these problems can lead to functional impairments which can impact the quality of life and even determine an individual’s ability to […]
item.content:encoded:
Many older adults are faced with age-related problems such as loss of balance, declining muscular strength, osteoporosis, arthritis and decreased mobility.

ut these same individuals still want to live a full life. Any of these problems can lead to functional impairments which can impact the quality of life and even determine an individual’s ability to live independently.

After an initial movement assessment, our therapists develop an individualized treatment plan to address each client’s specific problems, helping to improve their ability to perform common everyday activities and maintain an independent lifestyle. Treatment plans may include continued physical therapy using manual therapy (joint and soft-tissue mobilization) combined with therapeutic exercise, and other treatment modalities.

Research has shown that physical therapy can be effective in reducing the pain of hip and knee osteoarthritis, which is very common among older adults. When therapy is initiated early in individuals with osteoarthritis, it may be possible to decrease the use of pain medication as well as reduce or delay the incidence of surgery!

At MOTI, our staff of highly trained therapists has the experience and skills to evaluate the physical function of older adults with a variety of physical problems, helping them return to a more active and rewarding lifestyle!

item.title: Golfers
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: When it comes to golf, adding yards to your game and improving joint mobility and stability are top priorities when creating a consistent and powerful swing. We help professional, collegiate and recreational golfers of all ages and skill levels identify physical and biomechanical limitations so they can enhance their athleticism and optimize overall golf performance. […]
item.content:encoded:
When it comes to golf, adding yards to your game and improving joint mobility and stability are top priorities when creating a consistent and powerful swing.

We help professional, collegiate and recreational golfers of all ages and skill levels identify physical and biomechanical limitations so they can enhance their athleticism and optimize overall golf performance. We also work with golfers recovering from an injury to get them back on the course at full strength.

By utilizing advanced technology, physical therapy techniques, specialized equipment and expertise, we can provide golfers with a personalized analysis and individualized treatment plan to gain the confidence, strength, and mobility to improve their game. Our services include a 3 Dimensional Functional Movement Assessment to determine areas of biomechanical dysfunction and to devise a plan for improved joint mobility, muscle activation, and joint stability. We offer video analysis of movement and swing, and we can coordinate with your golf pro to improve swing mechanics for your body type. We work with the golfer to develop a training program that includes an exercise plan and complete game warm-up for home and the course. At MOTI most golfers benefit greatly through the use of the TRUEStretch Cage to improve mobility and stability of relevant golf positions.

item.title: Football Players
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: As a collision sport, football is a hotbed for injury. Traumatic injuries such as ACL and/or meniscus tears in the knees or labrum tears in the shoulder can be the result of a collision with another player or can happen during the dynamic movement of non-impact play. Football players may also find their performance compromised […]
item.content:encoded:
As a collision sport, football is a hotbed for injury.

Traumatic injuries such as ACL and/or meniscus tears in the knees or labrum tears in the shoulder can be the result of a collision with another player or can happen during the dynamic movement of non-impact play. Football players may also find their performance compromised by overuse injuries like lower back pain or knee stiffness and pain. At MOTI, we will help the football player rehabilitate the injury and return to sport. We also play a large role in the recovery and rehabilitation from concussion injuries.

MOTI is set apart from the average physical therapy clinic in that the facility offers a large movement space, top tier equipment, blood flow restriction training (BFR), advanced programming developed through science and led by experienced Doctors of Physical Therapy. 

With football athletes we focus on: 

  • Advanced movement strategies trained through quality repetition 
  • Improvement of Athletic Performance
  • Importance of recovery strategies and self-care
  • Tailored programming designed around the individual 
  • Well rounded training to feel better, stay healthy, and perform at the peak of your game

As a former football player turned coach with 12+ years of experience, Dr. Kirk Ramirez, PT, DPT is familiar with the demands of the sport and is able to specialize in the treatment and training of competitive athletes. He now serves as team doctor on the sidelines on Friday nights for 2 Covina area high school football programs. Utilizing his experience balanced with evidence-based clinical approach, he can help athletes get back on the field or provide optimized training to attain a competitive edge.

item.title: Expectant Mothers & New Mothers
item.dc:creator: james2
item.description: Physical therapy during pregnancy can be useful for remedying common discomforts like back pain or for enhancing your body’s ability to have a smoother pregnancy and birth. Additional weight, poor posture, stress and control of the center of gravity are not independent from one another. A change in your center of gravity affects your posture, which […]
item.content:encoded:
Physical therapy during pregnancy can be useful for remedying common discomforts like back pain or for enhancing your body’s ability to have a smoother pregnancy and birth.

Additional weight, poor posture, stress and control of the center of gravity are not independent from one another. A change in your center of gravity affects your posture, which causes the muscles to work harder. Increased exertion creates fatigue, which leads to a decreased motivation to be active. The absence of an athletic release often results in increased stress. This domino effect can be slowed greatly with the help of physical therapy.

Lower back pain is an all too common reality for many expecting mothers. As the uterus and baby grow, the mother’s center of gravity moves forward. This shift increases the amount of force the muscles must generate for everyday support causing women to slump forward. Over time this poor alignment creates muscle tightness in the pectoral muscles, rolling the shoulders forward and creating increased stress on the muscles of the neck, shoulders and mid-back. If these muscular factors are not addressed, these forces will ultimately be translated down to the low back, an area which is already under a great deal of stress because it is supporting the increased center of gravity.

At MOTI, we work with expectant mothers to relieve these common pregnancy symptoms. Our Physical Therapists identify harmful movement patterns and imbalances, and then work to create a balance of mobility and stability for the expectant mother. For most pregnant women, your plan of care will include a home exercise regimen to help you sustain this balance throughout your pregnancy.

Additionally, exercise increases physical endurance and muscle strength, especially in the hips, back and abdomen. Improving these areas can prepare the body for the physically demanding event of delivering a baby. Finally, therapeutic exercise during pregnancy can assist the recovery after the delivery. It tones muscle which will improve metabolism, decrease the severity of fatigue, and assist in reclaiming your pre-pregnancy weight.
